issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
Need to check to see if this is still valid against 4.x
see:
http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GERONIMO-1494
fields.summary: Potential infinite loop in ActiveMQ shutdown processing when in Geronimo

comments.body: ActiveMQ 4 has been integrated in the Geronimo 1.2 branch but that branch is still not under heavy delveopment and use yet as folks are focused on 1.1.  We should have a 4.1 our by the time G 1.2 is out and we can verify all is well at that time.

Stack trace from the GERONIMO-1494  issue:
{code}
17:30:34,325 WARN [TransportChannelSupport] Caught exception dispatching message and no ExceptionListener registered: javax.jms.JMSException: asyncSend failed: java.io.EOFException: Cannot write to the stream any more it has already been closed

Caused by: java.io.EOFException: Cannot write to the stream any more it has already been closed 
at org.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpBufferedOutputStream.checkClosed(TcpBufferedOutputStream.java:132)

{code}
Just checked 5.0 and this cannot happen since we guard against recursion in the ActiveMQConnection.close() method.
